answers.text: from deductions taken from their start value

qas.question: How is the start vaule determined?

answers.text: e start value of a routine is based on the difficulty of the elements the gymnast attempts and whether or not the gymnast meets composition requirements

qas.question: Deductions in execution and artistry are taken from what score?
What were added to scoring in 2007?

answers.text: adding bonus plus the execution and then adding those two together to get the final score

qas.question: What is another name for a 10.0?

plausible_answers.text: this score is called the D score.

qas.question: What is it called when a gymnast barely passes?
What score is determined by the fans?
When was the E score first implemented?
What deductions are taken from the E score?

context: A gymnast's score comes <a0_0>from deductions taken from their <b5_0>start value<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Th<a1_0>e start value of a routine is based on the difficulty of the elements the gymnast attempts and whether or not the gymnast meets composition requirements<a1_0/>. The composition requirements are different for each apparatus; <b6_0>this score is called the <a2_0>D score<a2_0/>.<b6_0/> <b9_0>Deductions in execution and artistry<b9_0/> are taken from <a3_0>10.0<a3_0/>. This score is called the <b7_0>E score<b7_0/>. The final score is calculated by taking deductions from the E score, and adding the result to the D score. Since <b8_0>2007<b8_0/>, the scoring system has changed by <a4_0>adding bonus plus the execution and then adding those two together to get the final score<a4_0/>.
